head.supplied: Crown Lands Office ¶ Adelaide 26 May 1869 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ In reply to your letter of the 15th Inst addressed to the Deputy Surveyor General, ¶ requesting him to authorise a portion of the collection of p...

div.p: GRG 35/2 inwards correspondence, no. 69/322, Department of Lands, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.

This letter, headed ' Draft ', written in an unknown hand and signed by James Blackmore, is filed with M's letter to Arthur Cooper (see n. 2 below).
Crown Lands Office

In reply to your letter of the 15th Inst addressed to the Deputy Surveyor General,
See M to A. Cooper, 15 May 1869 (in this edition as 69-05-15b). requesting him to authorise a portion of the collection of plants &c which have arrived, or may arrive, from the Northern Territory, to be sent to your department, I am desired by the Honorable the Commissioner of Crown Lands to inform you that he has received only one instalment as yet, which was at once handed by him, in the ordinary course, to Dr Richard Schomburgk, Director of the Botanic Gardens in this city.

As it was arranged that several specimens of each plant, &c, would be secured, with a view to exchanges with, and distribution to, the various Scientific gentlemen in correspondence with Dr Schomburgk, I am to request you to place yourself in communication with that gentleman, who will be most happy to furnish you with any specimens he may be able to supply.
